channel.title: [666] Online Mapdata Dumping Database Client
channel.description:
View mapdata: [url=http://www.rushgamer.com/mapdata]http://www.rushgamer.com/mapdata[/url]
[b]I Know this is a bit late Build #666 came out Sept, 15, 2011 sorry about that but i'm getting very lazy doing this[/b]
(Hopefully you guys won't ruin this by submitting false mapdata.. although i'll have a fix for this in the future.. where i'll check do some kind of cache check.)
I'll keep updating the online version of mapdata to make it downloadable in compressed format of txt files.. and maybe even a binary format.
[url=http://www.mediafire.com/?l7746c9h59bef8v]666 db mapdumper.zip[/url]
If anyone has any doubts if this is keylogged or anything in that matter.. I dont know what to say but you have to trust me, it does send data to rushgamer.com.. but that data doesn't contain your username or password, only mapdata keys+regionIndex
Credits go to 03data for his good deobfuscator without it, I wouldn't know where to put mapdata method, and Graham too I used his loader in this.
Don't want your server looking like this do you? so help us and yourself get all the mapdata.
What happens if you have missing mapdata. [img]http://img269.imageshack.us/img269/1899/missingmapdata.png[/img]

item.title: [666] Online Mapdata Dumping Database Client
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Miss Silabsoft:

Why not just remove the cipher for the private server client and then download the entire cache.

But you need all the XTEA keys to decrypt the map data from the cache, you can download the entire cache, but a lot of it is encrypted.

Read full topic

item.title: [666] Online Mapdata Dumping Database Client
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

Why not just remove the cipher for the private server client and then download the entire cache.

Read full topic

item.title: [666] Online Mapdata Dumping Database Client
item.dc:creator: @_Discardedx21 `Discardedx2`
item.description:
@_Discardedx21 wrote:

that idea will fail though as for new regions that are way out of place from any other character

Read full topic

item.title: [666] Online Mapdata Dumping Database Client
item.dc:creator: @sspoke sspoke
item.description:
@sspoke wrote:

yeah i had the idea as well to place chars in places…

Wouldn’t be as much characters if you think… dont really need 2200+ characters

as each character loads map regions all around himself too… I think it’s a box effect but not 100% sure…

Like

MMM
MXM
MMM

Player at


[ul][li],[y][/li][/ul]
[x+1],[y]

[ul][li],[y+1][/li][/ul]
[x-1],[y]

[ul][li],[y-1][/li][/ul]
[x+1],[y+1]
[x-1],[y-1]
[x+1],[y-1]
[x-1],[y+1]

so you could put char skipping one mapdata in all positions.

So around ~250 characters can get all mapdata

Lets estimate that half are member lands (of course more then 80% are member lands)

so 125 accounts must have membership that’s about 625$ / month, hahaha.

Then again… some mapdata cannot be gotten as you get teleported out as you log out… so that will take a little work… [minigames]

As well as some which are not accessible like tutorial island

Read full topic

item.title: [666] Online Mapdata Dumping Database Client
item.dc:creator: @_Discardedx21 `Discardedx2`
item.description:
@_Discardedx21 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:7, topic:415098”][quote author=Metho D link=topic=517057.msg3755321#msg3755321 date=1316391711]

Just how many different, uh, mapdata regions?, are there? Couldn’t this be automated by having a character standing in each one of them, and then on every update just have a script log onto each one of them sequentially? The only issue would be members areas.

There are 2,227 map regions currently. And yes, you could have a character standing in the majority of them to grab the XTEA key when a region is updated.
[/quote]

I wonder how many regions are member vs free though? And do you know if a hacked client can request the keys for a region they aren’t standing in or not? (I’m assuming not, that would be a gaping hole Jagex would fix quickly)[/quote]

not unless you plan on finding a way to make the client appear to say “teleport” a player around (even if it’s not truly teleporting anywhere, it would be like force requesting a region update), which i don’t think is possible, or it wouldn’t be easy anyways. there is however ways you can bruteforce the xtea. one of my friends from r-s got half of the 474 xtea keys in about 2 days. i know how to do it it’s just theres a special algorithm you have to formulate in order to generate a new xtea key

Read full topic

item.title: [666] Online Mapdata Dumping Database Client
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Metho D, post:6, topic:415098”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=517057.msg3755256#msg3755256 date=1316387115]
Just how many different, uh, mapdata regions?, are there? Couldn’t this be automated by having a character standing in each one of them, and then on every update just have a script log onto each one of them sequentially? The only issue would be members areas.
[/quote]

There are 2,227 map regions currently. And yes, you could have a character standing in the majority of them to grab the XTEA key when a region is updated.[/quote]

I wonder how many regions are member vs free though? And do you know if a hacked client can request the keys for a region they aren’t standing in or not? (I’m assuming not, that would be a gaping hole Jagex would fix quickly)

Read full topic

item.title: [666] Online Mapdata Dumping Database Client
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

People definitely have a better understanding of the new clients now than they used to, things like script editors and obfuscated client tools are pretty common now on the other sites (yea, this site is def more retro)

I’m pretty sure that they even have cache reading things INSIDE a lot of higher revision sources now, for map data and stuff like that. Pretty interesting stuff.

Read full topic

item.title: [666] Online Mapdata Dumping Database Client
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote="Discardedx2, post:3, topic:415098"][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=517057.msg3755256#msg3755256 date=1316387115]
Just how many different, uh, mapdata regions?, are there? Couldn’t this be automated by having a character standing in each one of them, and then on every update just have a script log onto each one of them sequentially? The only issue would be members areas.
[/quote]

this tool is useless anyways. i built a tool that auto injects calls into the obfuscated runescape client in order to dump xtea. ill probably post it here on mopar in about 10 minutes, as if it makes a difference seeing as no one here even does the newer servers[/quote]

Certainly one that automatically updates itself would be better, I’d like to see that tool.

Read full topic
